title: FindAir – Asthma Diary
description:
FindAir application is a smart asthma diary for your smartphone. No more manually filling in data every time you use your medicine. With FindAir, you can easily add all information with single clicks and monitor your progress to better understand your asthma.

The key to proper asthma therapy is relevant data. Without it, neither you nor your doctor is able to make the right decisions. The app helps you easily collect data about every use of your rescue and regular drugs, your treatment progress, as well as environmental information such as air pollution, weather conditions and allergens in your area. FindAir also allows you to monitor the number of doses you have left in the packaging and predict when it will end.

Moreover, the application connects to the FindAir ONE device - a smart add-on for inhalers. This device allows you to monitor your treatment progress more precisely, generate reports for yourself as well as your doctor and receive real-time notifications of hazards in the environment.

The FindAir application is one of the most popular asthma diaries in the world and has been appreciated by asthmatics and specialists from all over Europe


Basic functionalities of the FindAir application:

+ Asthma diary filled-in with single clicks (drug intake, peak flow, symptoms, notes)
+ View the status of all your rescue and regular drugs in one place
+ Information on possible triggers your asthma attacks
+ Warnings about hazards in the area
+ Reminders to take medication
+ Reports on treatment progress for you and your doctor
+ Integration with the FindAir ONE device for monitoring inhalers

summary: Find out what triggers your asthma attacks. Understand and predict your asthma
recentChanges: - Bug fixes
comments: All of the features I'd like to use are locked in the premium version and there seems to be no trial version or way to explore premium features and see if I'd like to make the purchase before committing--uninstalling for now but may reinstall and take another look if there is a trial of premium. app looks good other than having so many of its functions unavailable in the free version
I have moderate asthma. This app is very helpful because now know how many puffs I've got left. My problem is I now have to manually add the dose if I press the + button it won't do anything.
Looks like it would be a good app if all the important features weren't locked behind an upgrade... which there's no way to do via app OR Play Store.

The issue hasn't been fixed I cannot add my main medication as when I click save it takes me to main medication page and it doesn't show. I tried to resolve it by sending message but when I come to check it today that's broken to. The app is complete disaster when it supposed to be help tool for people with asthma. They're also selling some ad on to classic asthma pumps which is why I suggest Google removes this app before someone falls for this scam.

A bit hard to add inhalers, a bit counterintuitive. I have the same inhaler for treatment and rescue. However, I am not able to add it as both - the app automatically switches the inhaler to the other category. Might be impossible to follow up with my doses in this case (not sure if I can add more doses to my regular medication than what I set up). I like that it has air quality, weather and pollen in the same place, as I am affected by all these and have had to use separate apps.

title: Asthma Inhaler Diary
description:
Features:
- Quick entry of usage.
- Dashboard and charts give a quick overview of usage.
- Data stored online in the cloud.
- Can be shared with another user in real-time (useful for parents).
- Supports adding multiple users, switching between them easily.
- Can access on any android phone/tablet, existing data will still be there.
- Export your data in CSV format.
- Ad supported with subscription available to remove these.
- Requires sign-in via Google.
- Dark mode available in settings.

Still being developed, please provide feedback via the app to improve it further.

recentChanges: Fix for pie chart.
comments: Not sure why a asthma diary needs to be signed into Google. Apart from spying on you and to bombard you with adds for stuff they think are relevant.

Highley recommended. My asthma over the past 3 months has aggressively begain to get more uncontrollable, this app has really help when I so doctor ect... I have passed this app to the John Radcliffe hospital in Oxfordshire I really hope it gets the recognition it deserves it realy has helped me thank you.

Works good I have COPD and use my inhaler a lot and I forget sometimes when I last used it, I need to stay under max usage for that day, I like the different views, probably use the calendar mostly so I can monitor that day all in all a good app will probably buy ad free need more time with it to see if works in my situation
Safiya smith

title: Smart Asthma: Forecast Asthma with Peak Flow Chart
description:
Helps you control your asthma and prepare for a healthier lifestyle, all on your smartphone.

• AI forecast helps you prepare and prevent attacks
• 3 colour zones tell you when you are getting better or worse
• Conveniently share accurate peak flow charts with your nurse/doctor in a few taps
• The app reminds you to take readings and notes, to help give you back control

The Smart Asthma app is free, and you will need to buy the Smart Peak Flow device online

The smart sensor in the device is more accurate than normal peak flow meters

• It works with any smartphone and connects by the audio jack or our Bluetooth Adapter
• No batteries or charging needed

Our application supports 28 languages: English, Afrikaans, Arabic, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Persian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Serbian, Simplified Chinese, Spanish, Swedish, Traditional Chinese, Turkish, Ukrainian, Swedish

To get a Smart Peak Flow meter, visit: www.smartpeakflow.com
Delivered worldwide within 3 to 5 days

summary: Forecast & manage your asthma with the world's first AI-based peak flow meter
recentChanges: If you don't want to use the app on your phone's language, you can now switch to one of 28 languages.
comments: Not keen on the cheesy wording of the reminders, and the device swivels in my phone port, so blowing into it feels like it might not be accurate. Useful to have a log of readings, though, and it's more precise than the peak flow meter supplied by my GP. I paid for the device at the end of the free trial, and I'm almost convinced it was worth it.

New to the product and app, but seems easy to use. Had trouble with the device plugged directly into my phone, but works fine via Bluetooth. Much smaller than the standard peak flow meter which is a massive bonus. Hopefully I'll start taking regular readings now which I never used to do with the manual device. Whether it helps with my Asthma remains to be seen.

For the modern asthmatic, this app is good. It records your peak-flows, grades them and let's you look at some basic stats. It also records your daily symptoms and logs reliever uses. The advice it gives is generic though. Export to CSV is nice. Setup for the Bluetooth was a little tricky as it didn't want to communicate at first. The beta "AI Prediction" is a waste of time at the moment. Best it could say after 11 days was "90% chance I'll be in either of the 2 zones I've always been in.

Newly diagnosed asthmatic so much easier to use than bigger peak flow meter and paper chart. The daily reminders are great too so I don't forget to take my preventer each day too. Would definitely recommend as when Dr asks how my asthma is I can quickly show them my chart on my phone which most of us carry all the time....! It takes a few minutes to connect and use but it really is so convenient and easy to pack and take away.

I've only just started using it but have found it easy to use. My asthma nurse is interested to see how this could help other patients monitor their asthma and has asked me to send her my chart in the next couple of months. She had never heard of the device, for me I wanted something that would be easy to use and hassle free.

title: AsthmaMD
description:
AsthmaMD is a FREE Android  asthma and COPD management application.

AsthmaMD Peak Flow Meter is now available at every CVS and Walgreens in US (not required to use the app).

It's been the leading app on iphone and the number 1 app recommended by doctors. 

Featured on CBS news, the Wall Street Journal, Toronto Global, USA today, Forbes, Mobile Health News, Tech Crunch and more...

AsthmaMD is easy and quick to use to help you with tracking and managing your Asthma and COPD.

Created by Sam Pejham, MD who wanted a better way to care for his asthma patients. 

Keep a journal of your asthma easily and quickly.

Visualize your asthma activity on a color graph.

Share asthma diary and color graph with your physician.

Use AsthmaMD to help doctors with asthma research.

Manage multiple users with one device, great for families.

Easily pick from a list of medications or add your own. 

Track how medication is helping you manage asthma.

Instantly map your PFM to severity zones.

Track asthma triggers such as:

Allergies, Pollens, Pollutants, etc.

Customize to track FEV1 or PulseOX data. 

AsthmaMD not only helps you track your asthma and COPD but you will also be helping doctors and researchers learn more about asthma, and other asthma sufferers like yourself learn about high asthma locations.
You have an option to participate anonymously and securely using systems managed by google to provide researchers with information that has never been available before. Imagine helping a parent find an area to move that has a lower asthma rates, or pick a school in an area with a lower rate of asthma attacks.

We are going to change asthma research and you have a chance to be part of it.

Support us and asthma and COPD research by downloading and using this app and telling other asthma patients about it.

We want to hear from you, email us at help@AsthmaMD.org

recentChanges: added privacy policy
comments: Same as the other comments, can't create an account, just keeps saying bad request and to check the information... Shame since this looks like it would be a useful app.

Nice features but buggy operation. Adding entries to my records and when I look in the daily report section what is displayed or not displayed on any given record keeps changing, lines of info just disappear. Yes, I'm saving them each time. It's very frustrating as the long term picture is what I'm interested in most, and being able to share accurate records with my doctor. Added medications frequently disappear from the list too. I'll try a few more days but also look for a more reliable app.

Frustrating app to use. Save record button not prominent so it didn't save the last few days records. Have to click into each line to enter data, too many clicks. Chart doesn't seem to display (perhaps I hadn't entered enough data?). Clunky. Much preferred Asthma Tracker but y Roving Reptiles but unfortunately that seems to have been discontinued. Will delete this app.
Does not allow sign up. Give error when attempting to sign up.
Cant sign up. Keeps saying "Bad Request." All fields were filled out.

title: Asthma Tracker
description:
Asthma Tracker 3 supports you in keeping your asthma diary up-to-date by making it easy to track your peak flow values, your asthma medication intake and your asthma related symptoms. In addition, you can add contextual information to each entry by either associating it with a pre-defined event (such as a doctor’s appointment) or with individual notes.

With the built-in reminder, you can set Asthma Tracker to remind you to take your daily base medication, to measure your peak flow and to record your symptoms. At the end of each month, it will also prompt you to complete the widely-known Asthma Control Test™ whose intent is to give you a rough idea as to how well controlled your asthma is.

The aggregated information in Asthma Tracker's chronological overview leverages lets you quickly asses how your asthma is progressing. Asthma Tracker also displays your daily step count from Google Fit. This way you can easily see how your daily activity influences your asthma and related symptoms.

Select individual days to get a more detailed view of each entry (peak flow, puffs or symptoms) on that particular day.

Do you have feedback for us or do you need help? Visit us at www.asthma-app.com and use the feedback form on our website.

summary: Probably the most beautiful Asthma app to-date
recentChanges:
• Entries for past dates: Choose for which date you want to add entries for PEF, puffs and symptoms. This way you can add asthma data from your paper
• Take Notes: Add notes to give your and your doctor more context information when looking at certain entries or assessing how your asthma is progressing. Choose between a set of pre-defined notes or free-text entry.
• Multiple medications
comments: It collects much more data than other apps, such as symptoms, peak flow, notes and medication, but I feel the interface could be improved by setting the data out differently, perhaps in graph form as usually asthmatics want an overview of their symptoms for analysis, i find it difficult to compare data when it is set out day to day. But its a good app, no usage issues.

I use this daily to track peak flow. It would be useful to be able to export my results as a spreadsheet, and to be able to export more than the past month in detail. I would like to export all my results for every time I have used the app.

I've used this app for over a year now and find it really useful to keep track of how much ventolin I've needed. I think it would be useful to be able to download data older than one year ago for comparison.
I'm trying to map my kids symptoms. This will only work if you connect it to Google fit on your phone. Dumb.
Waste of time. I wanted an app to monitor my child's asthma symptoms and it wanted to monitor my activity via Google fit before it would do anything.

title: Home Remedy for Asthma
description:
Asthma is a chronic inflammatory disease that affects the air passages that carry air from the nasal area and mouth to lungs and vice versa. 

Causes:
Allergies
Smoke and tobacco
Environmental factors, like air pollution
Obesity
Stress, tension, and depression
Genetics
Lung infection during childhood
Premature birth
Certain foods, like fish, soy, eggs, peanuts, etc.
Excessive Exercise
Heartburn

Symptoms:
Difficulty in breathing
A wheezing or whistling sound while breathing
Coughing
Congested chest
Feeling tired while doing any physical activity
Frequent cold and cough
Uneasiness in sleeping

title: Asthma: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Asthma is a common long-term inflammatory disease of the airways of the lungs. It is characterized by variable and recurring symptoms, reversible airflow obstruction, and bronchospasm. Symptoms include episodes of wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, and shortness of breath. These episodes may occur a few times a day or a few times per week. Depending on the person, they may become worse at night or with exercise. 
Asthma is thought to be caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. Environmental factors include exposure to air pollution and allergens. Other potential triggers include medications such as aspirin and beta blockers. Diagnosis is usually based on the pattern of symptoms, response to therapy over time, and spirometry. Asthma is classified according to the frequency of symptoms, forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1), and peak expiratory flow rate. It may also be classified as atopic or non-atopic, where atopy refers to a predisposition toward developing a type 1 hypersensitivityreaction. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Asthma symptoms, Asthma management, Asthma causes, Asthma diagnosis, Asthma Prognosis, Asthma Epidemiology and history. 
Here are features that make this app better than all other Asthma Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications. If you have liked any feature and information of this app, please do not forget to rate us on play store. This app does not accept any responsibility for any loss, which may arise from reliance on ads & information contained on this app.

title: Asthma+me
description:
Asthma+me App is a Class 1 medical device Self-Care solution to support parents and carers of children aged 6-12 who have moderate to severe asthma.
Asthma+me was developed in collaboration with a leading NHS Paediatric Hospital in the UK.
Asthma+me App is a subscription service with a monthly charge. The first month is free of charge.

Included in the Asthma+me App is:

1.	Clinician-approved Education syllabus on Asthma management: series of 56 simple lessons delivered daily, provided training and instruction for the family. Included at the end of each lesson is a simple quiz to confirm understanding.
2.	Wireless connectivity to self-monitoring devices: Connect PUFFClicker inhaler trackers, Peak Flow/FEV1 monitor, BuddyBand2 Activity Tracker, Body Analyser Smart Scales to monitor key physiological signs.
3.	Medication: record the medication prescribed for each family member and track doses and use of batches of the prescription (eg inhaler in the bag, at home, at school, in the car etc). Include non-inhaler medications such as antibiotics, steroids, antihistamines etc.
4.	Charts and Reports: Generate custom charts to identify trends. Create pre-configured report as a PDF which can be printed, emailed or exported to clinical centres using Asthma+me.
5.	Motivation: encouraging children and young people to adhere to their Care Plan and medication routine can be a challenge for all family members or carers. Asthma+me includes a configurable rewards capability for the child(ren) to work towards, earning points for every action completed each day to motivate and encourage.
6.	Care Plan: Asthma+me brings together all of your child(ren)’s information in one, easy-to-read and printable or emailable Care Plan. EVERYONE with asthma should have a written care plan. Print and give to schools, friends, family, carers, GP and Hospitals to give clear instructions in the event of an asthma attack. 


Medical device

The Asthma+me App is classified as a Class 1 medical device under MEDDEV  2. 4/1 Rev. 9 June 2010 as per the requirements set out in Annex IX of Directive 93/42/EEC as amended 2007/47/EC.

Intended Use: 
Asthma+me is a mobile application intended for use in the home to assist people to receive and review information from connected medical and non-medical devices, track medication use and record other events such as asthma attacks, for effective health self-management. The user also can share the data via sharing functions. 




Health and Safety Notices:
Asthma+me App is not intended to monitor vital physiological parameters where variation could result in immediate danger.

Asthma can be a life-threatening condition. Always take the medication as prescribed. If you experience any asthma-related symptoms of shortness of breath that does not get better after using your Reliever inhaler; trouble walking and talking because of shortness of breath; blue lips or fingernails; severe wheezing; or a peak flow reading of less than 50% of your personal best, refer to your Care Plan and follow the instructions carefully. If you continue to have symptoms, consult your medical team. 
Do not rely on the Asthma+me App to diagnose or treat your Asthma.
Only recommended to help support children age 6 years of age and over and only under adult supervision. 
Do not rely solely on the Reminder capabilities of the Asthma+me App to take your prescribed medication as directed by your medical team.
If you experience any serious incident that occurs in relation to the Asthma+me App, please report this to Aseptika Limited (Activ8rlives) and the competent authority of the Member State in which you are based.

Intended Use:
Asthma+me is a mobile application intended for use in the home to assist people to receive and review information from connected medical and non-medical devices, track medication use and record other events such as asthma attacks, for effective health self-management. The user also can share the data via sharing functions.




Health and Safety Notices:
Asthma+me App is not intended to monitor vital physiological parameters where variation could result in immediate danger.

Asthma can be a life-threatening condition. Always take the medication as prescribed. If you experience any asthma-related symptoms of shortness of breath that does not get better after using your Reliever inhaler; trouble walking and talking because of shortness of breath; blue lips or fingernails; severe wheezing; or a peak flow reading of less than 50% of your personal best, refer to your Care Plan and follow the instructions carefully. If you continue to have symptoms, consult your medical team.
Do not rely on the Asthma+me App to diagnose or treat your Asthma.
Only recommended to help support children age 6 years of age and over and only under adult supervision.
Do not rely solely on the Reminder capabilities of the Asthma+me App to take your prescribed medication as directed by your medical team.
If you experience any serious incident that occurs in relation to the Asthma+me App, please report this to Aseptika Limited (Activ8rlives) and the competent authority of the Member State in which you are based.
summary: Asthma+me: Class 1 medical device app for parents/carers of asthmatic children.

title: Peak Flow
description:
Peak Flow allows you to record your daily peak flow readings and helps you to keep track of your Asthma.

Features
- Record peak expiratory flow (PEF).
- Specify if a reading is taken pre or post medication.
- Record comments against your readings.
- View your most recent readings at a glance or scroll through your entire history.
- Plot your results as weekly or monthly graphs.
- Automatically calculate and plot your green, yellow and red zones along with your personal best.
- Share your graphs over services such as Email, Bluetooth and Instant Message
- Export your data to SD card or upload it to a storage service such as Google Drive.
- Support for English and German languages.

Required Permissions
- Photos / Media / File - This permission is required to allow Peak Flow to export data to local storage.

recentChanges:
New options within settings:
- Display lowest PEF reading on the graphs.
- Enable/disable horizontal and/or vertical markers on the graphs.
- Display post-medication markers on the graph as a coloured marker, coloured line or separate series.
Support for Android 9+.
Several bug fixes.
comments: Very handy app for tracking how your asthma is doing and especially handy at the moment as in the UK asthma check ups are over the phone so with this app I am able to tell the nurse my readings over a period rather than taking one reading on the day I am seeing her. It is also handy for seeing if your asthma has a pattern (my asthma is not as good in the winter). It's great to start to see a visual improvement when you are feeling a bit better after a bad spell.
Simple to use, and really good. It would be useful if the data could be automatically backed up to the cloud (eg Google Drive is or Dropbox or whatever)

Charts are totally off compared with my daughters peak flow monitor. Her peak flow device registers as red up to 120, yellow up to 180 and green is over 200. On this app, green shows much lower so her readings are showing as green when they're actually in the red.
Perfect app for saving and monitoring your peak flow values like if you have asthma. Does everything you could possibly want in an app like this. And it's really simple to use.

very useful, only problem set points for yellow & red zones can't be altered, and are in the wrong place for me. I have action plan from Asthma clinic with the values listed. Response:- Overall very good app, I have tried altering personal best but still can't get zones to match my Asthma plan. small problem though.

title: SaniQ Asthma - Lung & Allergy
description:
SaniQ Asthma is your digital health diary with numerous useful features.

In the app you can quickly and easily document everything important about your health: Medical measurements, symptoms & much more. 

The SaniQ Asthma app supports you with daily challenges: It reliably reminds you to take measurements and take medication. You can also manage your medicine in the app.

SaniQ Asthma is a medical device developed, maintained and registered in Germany.

Features

* Documentation of maximum exhalation rate (peak flow), one-second capacity (FEV1), weight & oxygen saturation
* Recording of medical measurements via Bluetooth using compatible measuring devices or by manual input
* Clear graphical & tabular display of measured values
* Creation of a health diary (PDF file) that you can forward to your doctor for analysis and evaluation, for example.
* Individual memory of taking your medication 
* Management of your medicine supply 
* Individual and up-to-date pollen flight information
* Secure storage of therapy documents, findings and emergency plans

Which advantages does SaniQ Asthma offer you?

* Notice earlier deteriorations in the process
* Enable your doctors to plan a sounder & targeted therapy 
* Analyse your measured values and adapt your lifestyle in a targeted way
* Improve your treatment with reliable measurements and drug revenue

SaniQ Asthma is free of advertising!

Compatible Bluetooth measurement devices

* MIR Smart One with Bluetooth (Peak Flow, FEV1)
* Beurer BF710 balance with Bluetooth (weight)
* any measuring instrument without radio connection

This app is registered as a Class 1 medical device according to the German Medical Devices Act. It is registered under the number DE/CA71/21a/07/2.3/2017/0043. SaniQ Asthma thus fulfils the requirements of the 93/42/EEC Directive of the European Union Council on Medical Devices. However, we expressly point out that the use of SaniQ Asthma does not replace a doctor's visit.

If you have any comments or tips on how to improve the app, simply send us an email. The SaniQ team is looking forward to hearing from you.

We wish you lots of fun and always good health with SaniQ!

title: Asthma
description:
Asthma is caused by an inflammation and obstruction of the bronchial tubes, the tubes that help the lung inhale and exhale air. In 2009, the American Academy of Asthma, Allergy and Immunology stated that one in every 12 people in the United States had a diagnosis of asthma, compared to one in 14 in 2001.  During an asthma attack, the muscles around the bronchial tubes tighten and swell, which narrows the air passages and thus makes it difficult for the person to breathe. Common triggers of asthma attacks include exposure to an allergen (like grass, tress, pollen, etc.), irritants in the air (such as smoke or strong smells), illnesses (like the flu), stress, extreme weather conditions (such as extreme heat), or physical exertion and exercise. 

Learning to recognize when you or someone else is having an asthma attack and knowing what to do can help save a life.

In this app, we explain how to recognize child with asthma, how to prevent asthma attacks, how to treat asthma, how to help someone with asthma attack as well as how to use an inhaler

Feel free to send us  your questions or suggestions.

title: Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker
description:
"Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker" is medical mobile app designed to help medical practitioner to stratifies asthma attack severity by calculating pediatric asthma score. Based on the result of pediatric asthma score, the severity of asthma attack will be classified by "Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker" app into three categories, namely mild asthma attack, moderate asthma attack, and severe asthma attack.

There are several features of "Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker", namely:
🔸 Simple and very easy to use asthma tracker app.
🔸 Precise calculation of pediatric asthma score.
🔸 Classification of asthma attack severity.
🔸 It is totally free. Download now!

Asthma, which occurs in adult and children patients, is a chronic inflammatory disorder of the airways characterized by an obstruction of airflow. Asthma is a heterogeneous disorde that is characterized by recurrent airway obstruction, bronchial hyper-responsiveness, and airway inflammation. Asthma is the most common chronic illness in children population. Download now "Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker" app.

Disclaimer: all calculations must be re-checked and should not be used alone to guide patient care, nor should they substitute for clinical judgment. Calculations in this "Pediatric Asthma Severity Score - Asthma Tracker" app might be different with your local practice. Consult to expert doctor whenever necessary.

title: Asthma Medications Guide
description:
asthma medications  app is book & referensce Overall, the goal of medical treatment is to control asthmatic symptoms as well as prevent any possible future. When you have asthma, you need to be under the care of a doctor who can track the various changes of the disease, your reaction to medications and treat accordingly.


In this app we will discuss:

signs of asthma
asthma medications
asthma
asthma symptoms
asthma treatment
inhaler
asthma inhalers
asthma action plan
asthma attack
understanding of asthma attacks
asthma attack understanding
the value of asthma attack and bronchial asthma



feature on the app

_ update once a week
_ useful tips that you will provide
_ a very simple look in the app.

little explanation about asthma medications: 

What Causes Asthma?

It has been determined that asthma now affects one out of 15 children in North America and is the most common chronic illness among young ones. This affliction is the result of chronic inflammation of bronchial tubes in the lungs. When these tubes become sensitive to certain allergens or irritants, they overreact and swell. When exposed to these irritants, the inflammation of these tubes will eventually constrict breathing.

There are several causes for this illness. Besides allergies, asthma can be stress-related, weight-related or job-related. Higher stress levels in the body tend to change the immune system and cause more inflammation of the air passage. Obesity is another contributor to this painful medical issue. Certain occupations with poor air quality have also been linked to this problem.

Common Symptoms 
There are several common symptoms that indicate a person has this disease but it can vary from person to person. They are shortness of breath, wheezing with a whistling or hissing sound when breathing, coughing, and tightness of the chest. They tend to show themselves with excessive exercise, cold air, or at night time.

The Goal Of Asthma Treatment 
In terms of diagnosis, the number one problem of this illness is that it resembles many other respiratory and heart conditions. There are many prevalent medicines that are commonly administered in this case. But, medications always show a better result when given on a case to case basis.

After a physical exam to find the severity of the attacks and a medical history to list possible triggers, the doctor will plan a long-term treatment of medications to take on a daily basis. Medications must be closely supervised by your doctor. So tell your doctor about any good reactions or bad side effects as soon as it happens.

Types Of Asthma Medications 
Medications used for treatment are bronchodilators, which relax the bronchial spasms, and corticosteroids, which reduce inflammation. Inhaled medications are preferred as they immediately are breathed into the affected area. These produce less side effects than oral medications of tablet or liquid medicines. Medications must be closely supervised by your doctor. So tell your doctor about any good reactions or bad side effects as soon as it happens.

Possible Side Effects 
There are hundreds of drugs related to treating this disease that are being dispersed every day. Anyone prescribed any kind of medication for this condition would be wise to check the Internet for side effects. Adrenaline, for example, is a medication that is still used on occasion but can result in rapid heart rate, nausea, vomiting, headache, restlessness and a sense of panic.

Special care should be taken with any asthma medication to be sure it is safe before using. Some people can take asthma medication with no ill effects. With others, a number of side effects have been reported. In addition to the above, other medicines are listed as causing seizures, heart failure, cirrhosis, high blood pressure, insomnia hives, bone fractures and too many others side effects to list. Many over the counter medicines also have side effects which are required, by law, to be listed in the package.

title: Asthma Aust – Asthma First Aid
description:
Welcome to ASTHMA first aid.

Covering both first aid use in the event of an asthma emergency plus the ability to review all the steps, ASTHMA first aid is your go-to tool for an asthma emergency.

This app is an educational tool developed by Asthma Australia for people with asthma, their families and carers. It provides easy access to the national community asthma first aid steps in both live and training versions.

Suitable for use in various community settings including family, friends, school, childcare, sport and recreation, this app allows you to:
• follow the community asthma first aid process live in ATTACK mode
• learn the community asthma first aid process in TRAINING REVIEW mode
• review the community asthma first aid process, using a sample of scenarios, in TRAINING SCENARIO mode

About Asthma Australia
For over 50 years Asthma Australia and Asthma Foundations have been the leaders in asthma health care, research and support. Asthma Australia delivers evidence-based preventative health strategies to over 200,000 people every year and provides support, training and resources to the primary health care sector. They fund vital basic science and population health research contributing to national and international understandings of asthma and how best to manage the disease.

title: ASTHMAXcel
description:
ASTHMAXcel is a fun, easy to use, and free app for patients with asthma. The app is available for smartphones and tablets, and has been clinically tested and linked to increased asthma knowledge, improved asthma control and quality of life, and decreased asthma emergency department visits and hospitalizations. ASTHMAXcel has been developed by a team of asthma physicians, software programmers, behavioral scientists, and an animation studio. 

ASTHMAXcel will teach you about asthma through interactive modules/chapters and short, fun animated videos. The program teaches important concepts about asthma and its management. Topics include how airways can be affected in asthma, how/when to use different inhalers, how to use a spacer, and how to reduce environmental triggers in your home. 

The pediatric app, ASTHMA Adventures (available soon!) consists of interactive movies, games, and quizzes to teach children and parents about asthma in a fun, engaging way. 

Download the ASTHMAXcel app then complete the 10 chapters to learn how to better control your asthma. 

Visit our website to learn more about ASTHMAXcel – www.asthmaxcel.net

For more information about permissions, visit http://www.asthmaxcel.net/legal.html and http://www.asthmaxcel.net/privacy.html

title: Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index
description:
"Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index" is a medical mobile app designed to help health practitioner or pediatrician to determine the chance of developing childhood asthma on patients aged less than 3 years old. "Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index" app is based on both strict criteria and loose criteria. Strict criteria for asthma predictive index will be used for children with more than 3 wheezing episodes per year. While loose criteria will be used for children with wheezing episodes less than 3 per year.

There are several features of "Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index", namely:
🔸 Simple and very easy to use asthma tracker chance app.
🔸 Precise calculation with Asthma Predictive Index formula.
🔸 Calculation based on strict and loose criteria.
🔸 Can be used to determine chance or likelihood of developing asthma in pediatric less than 3 years old.
🔸 It is totally free. Download now!

Health professionals and parents have long known that infants and small children will wheeze more than older children and adults, and that sometimes it leads to asthma. But it is often hard to diagnose asthma in such young patients and hard to predict which child would develop persistent (life-long) asthma. "Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index" app will help doctor to estimate the probability of developing asthma in children.

Disclaimer: all calculations must be re-checked and should not be used alone to guide patient care, nor should they substitute for clinical judgment. Calculations in "Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index" app might be different with your local practice. Consult to expert doctor whenever necessary.

Disclaimer: all calculations must be re-checked and should not be used alone to guide patient care, nor should they substitute for clinical judgment. Calculations in "Asthma Tracker Chance - Asthma Predictive Index" app might be different with your local practice. Consult to expert doctor whenever necessary.
summary: Asthma app to determine chance to get asthma on pediatric ≤ 3 years old
recentChanges: Determines the likelihood of developing childhood asthma on patients aged ≤3 years old

Amazing. There should be more apps like this

title: Asthma Management
description: A major population in India is suffering from asthma (15-20 million), placing a considerable pressure on patients, communities and health system. 90% of the patients suffering from asthma end up with the poor outcome because of following improper way of using an inhaler or not using an inhaler at all. This application provides a visual learning experience for the asthmatic patients and by filling the questionnaire, it provides us the information regarding the day to day problems faced by the asthmatic population. It also provides us the information regarding the outcome and feasibility of using an android based application over the paper-based asthma action plan(AAP).

title: Asthma Buddy
description:
Children’s Health Asthma Buddy provides children with asthma and their parents with a unique set of resources and tools to effectively and proactively manage their asthma. Children’s Health is focused on educating families on understanding asthma and empowering them to take charge of their child’s asthma management.

Asthma Buddy makes it easy for children and families to track the necessary information to help monitor and manage their asthma symptoms effectively over time, playing a major role in how families address asthma. 

Benefits:
• Provides quick access to valuable asthma education and management tools 
• Helps users track their asthma medication use and set reminders 
• Allows users to share their Asthma Action Plan and Asthma Control Test (ACT) scores 
• Encourages users to self-manage their asthma symptoms over time and track improvement
• Now includes account creation capabilities that enable you to track your data with across multiple devices

title: Propeller
description:
Propeller can help you follow your treatment plan and take control of your asthma.

Propeller is a digital health tool that has been used by over 100,000 people worldwide. The Propeller sensor discretely attaches to your asthma inhaler, gathers information about your medication use and sends that information to the Propeller app. The app builds your profile and provides personalized support to help you follow your doctor-recommended treatment plan.



Have a complete record
The Propeller sensor and app automatically record when you use your medication. 

Never forget a dose
Medication reminders can include chiming sensors, push notifications and in-app reminders.

Reports at your fingertips
Monthly summaries of inhaler use are accessible in the Propeller app and by email, and they can be easily shared with your doctor.

Start each day with confidence
A daily Asthma Outlook plus air quality and weather forecasts are generated based on your location.

Discover your triggers
You can keep a record of when and where you use your rescue inhaler to help learn what may be causing your flare-ups.

Find a lost inhaler 
You can use the Find My Inhaler feature of the Propeller app to “ring” a misplaced inhaler.

If you have asthma, ask your doctor if Propeller is compatible with your treatment.

title: Asthma Protocols
description:
Are you looking for Cure or Remedies for Asthma Attack? Would like to know Symptoms, Causes, Natural treatments.. This Free App provides 20 and more different Natural Alternative Therapies for Asthma Attack. When it comes to understanding all of the new asthma treatments available, it's natural to feel a little confused.

The important thing to remember is that asthma is a "variable" disease. In other words, the symptoms can vary from person to person, and even the same person's condition may fluctuate throughout the year.

Over the past few years, people have become more aware of complementary therapies and their use for treating various medical conditions, such as asthma. There are many reasons why some people choose to use complementary therapies. For example, they:
may want to reduce the amount of medicines or inhalers they use 
may prefer to use a “natural” alternative 
may be disillusioned with the approach of Western medicine
have heard from others that a particular complementary therapy works well for their condition
feel that using complementary therapies gives them more control over their treatment. 
If you are interested in using a complementary therapy for treating your asthma, it’s best that you base your decision on correct information, including the therapy’s potential risks, as well as its benefits. 
It is also recommended you get an informed, objective opinion from your health professional. 

What allergies trigger Asthma, or asthma related cough.. What are the Asthma treatment guidelines?

There are various modalities of alternative therapies which have indeed proven to be successful for many – but not all – people. Use of complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) to relieve asthma is increasingly common; traditionally, complementary and alternative medicine has been considered outside the realm of conventional medicine. Western medicine has focused on the acute treatment of disease and injury, whereas CAM typically promotes health and prevention of disease. Yet this distinction is changing. Complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) refers to an array of healing practices and medicines that exist outside of conventional treatments. These practices are thought to provide a more natural and holistic approach to healing a variety of ailments. Many people across the globe find success in getting relief from their Asthma Attack  with alternative techniques.
There are many different types of complementary therapies (CAM) out, and these should not be considered in isolation but as part of an overall approach to general well being. Many find themselves turning to complementary or "alternative" treatments out of frustration when they are having limited success with prescription drugs and other approved medical treatments.  This app will introduce you to some non-pharmaceutical therapies. These treatments offer many of us additional relief, but are NOT an excuse to abandoned approved medical care.  Rather they will offer you an opportunity to gain more control over your asthma problems and manage better health.  They will work better if integrated into your overall care. This is a Wellness app which you can do it yourself. However one may need Medical or Expert advice for certain protocols. We have protocols for Acupressure, Acupuncture, Aromatherapy, Ayurveda, Homeopathy, Bach Flower Remedy, Color Therapy, Diet and Nutrition, Exercise, Herbal Therapy, Juice Therapy, Physiotherapy, Reflexology, Shiatsu, Sound Therapy, Tai Chi, TCM, Vitamin Therapy, Yoga, Sujok, Auricular Therapy, Hydrotherapy, Rife Therapy, Visualization, Reiki, Magnet Therapy. These protocols when used under proper guidance gives more better feeling and as all the protocols are complementary / alternative therapy it comes with no side effects on application. For one problem – Asthma, this app provides you many different methods of alternative remedies to manage your respiratory health and that to absolutely FREE!!!

title: Asthma
description:
do you know How to find out if You Have "Asthma" or not ?
Isn’t it time to know about What Are the Signs and Symptoms of Asthma ?
Have you ever thought about Common causes of Asthma ?
Don’t worry , With Our App You will be able to find all the information about Asthma

what is asthma :

 • asthma definition 
 
"Asthma" is a common long-term inflammatory disease of the airways of the lungs . It is characterized by variable and recurring symptoms ,
reversible airflow obstruction , and bronchospasm . "asthma symptoms" include episodes of wheezing , coughing ...
These episodes may occur a few times a day or a few times per week. Depending on the person , they may become worse at night or with exercise induced asthma  .

 • causes of asthma

Asthma is thought to be caused by a combination of genetic and environmental factors. Environmental factors include exposure to air pollution 
and allergen . Other potential triggers include medications such as aspirin and beta blockers. Diagnosis is usually based on the pattern of symptoms , 
response to therapy over time , and spirometry . "Asthma" is classified according to the frequency of symptoms, forced expiratory volume in one second , 
and peak expiratory flow rate . It may also be classified as atopic or non-atopic , where atopy refers to a predisposition toward developing a type 1
hypersensitivity reaction

 • asthma symptoms 

bronchitis symptoms , which include wheezing , coughing , and chest tightness , are most common in an "asthma attack" . 
Sometimes "asthma" is called bronchial asthma or reactive airway disease .
 
  The Common Symptoms Of Asthma Are :

   - Wheezing (a whistling, squeaky sound when you breathe)
   - Shortness of breath
   - Rapid breathing
   - Chest tightness
   - Coughing
   
  • causes of asthma :
 
 - Tobacco Smoke
 - Dust Mites
 - Outdoor Air Pollution
 - Respiratory infections
 - Exercise
 - Hypersensitivity
 - Cockroach Allergen
 - Pets
 - Mold
 - Smoke From Burning Wood or Grass
 - Gerd
 - Other Triggers
  
  
   
   
   This app will tell you exactly :
   
   • How Can You Tell if You Have "Asthma" ?
   • Asthma copd differences between ?
   • What triggers bronchial asthma ?
   • What Is an Asthma Attack ?
   • Asthma signs and symptoms ?
   • Causes of Asthma Attack ?
   • How is asthma treated and controlled ?
   
   What more you can learn with our apps :
  
  - Bronchitis Symptoms
  - Asbestosis
  - Bronchiectasis
  - Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia
  - COPD
  - Cystic Fibrosis
  - Emphysema
  - Pneumonia
  - Laryngitis
  - Pharyngitis
  - Influenza
  - Lung Cancer
  - Tuberculosis
  - Pulmonary Fibrosis
  - Pulmonary Vascluar Disease
  - Allergy . Allergies , also known as allergic diseases
  
  
And much more.
you can get this application absolutely for free RIGHT NOW !!
So what are you waiting for?
Download now and enjoy

title: Asthma & Me
description:
Do your patients have asthma?  Show them the pathophysiology of asthma in their preferred language.

The Asthma & Me app uses face detection technology along with augmented reality to create an educational short video overlay of a diseased airway onto a patient’s video selfie.

The video can be used to facilitate the discussion with the patient of what is occurring during an asthma attack – airway inflammation, bronchiole constriction, and mucus production.

The app uses the patient’s own smartphone or tablet device settings to select their preferred language.

When the phone’s front or rear camera is aimed at an individual face, an animation of the lungs is overlaid and a short video illustrating the physiology of an asthma attack can be produced and recorded.

This video can them be saved and shared via social media or email.

Download the Asthma & Me app to give it a try.

Some information provided may not be valid for residents of other countries due to variations in medical practice and drug approval and indications.

This patient education application provides patients and Health Care Practitioners with easy to access information on Asthma and COPD management.

title: Breath Ball: The Stress Relief Breathing Exercise.
description:
5 things to consider before choosing a breathing app:
⭐️ Warning! Many breathing apps instruct you to inhale and exhale at a constant speed. This does not just feel unnatural, it can even cause you to adopt an unhealthy way of breathing, which can lead to health issues. Beware, even some of the most downloaded apps make this mistake!
Breath Ball's breathing is based on clinical observations of hundreds of humans. The app was specifically designed for clinical environments. That's why Breath Balls breathing exercises feel natural and work much better than any of the competing apps.
⭐️ No quackery: Breath Ball is based on sound scientific research. New breathing exercises are added only when there is sufficient research data available.
However, you can of course define your own breathing exercises and use Breath Ball for whatever you want.
⭐️ Maximum customizability: Our well being highly depends on what we like and dislike. Breath Ball is the only app you can fully customize to your liking: Colors, breathing exercises and even the size of the user interface can be adjusted to give you the breathing app that feels just right for you.
⭐️ Focus on simplicity: Breath Ball is incredibly easy to use and even the first breathing session usually leads to great results.
⭐️ Free: Even the free version of Breath Ball provides all the functionality you'll ever need.

These are the main reasons why leading medical professionals, therapists and biofeedback coaches use and recommend Breath Ball.

What is Breath Ball used for?
Breath Ball helps you to relieve stress and anxiety, soothe the symptoms of COPD and Asthma, lower high blood pressure and overcome sleeplessness with four easy breathing exercises. What might sound too simple to be true, is actually based on latest scientific research and is used to treat patients at rehab facilities and in clinical environments. So let's take a closer look at Breath Ball's breathing exercises and what they can do for you:

Breath Ball provides breathing exercises for these four use cases:

⭐️ The cardiac coherence breathing exercise is used to relieve stress and anxiety. It is thought to patients at rehab and bio-feedback trainings to help them get calm and relax.

⭐️ The COPD foundation’s recommended breathing technique helps to relieve the
symptoms of Asthma and COPD.

⭐️ Slow paced breathing is a complementary treatment against hypertension (high blood pressure). It goes back to Prof. Dr. Loew and is commonly used in clinical environments.

⭐️ Dr. Andrew Weil’s famous 4:7:8 breathing technique is used to get calm to fall asleep.

Each of these breathing exercises comes with a short tutorial that will get you started in less than two minutes. Beside that you can create your own breathing exercises; something yoga and pranayama coaches enjoy a lot.


Privacy concerns?
Please note: We truly value your privacy. Breath Ball does not collect any of your personal data. There is no Facebook integration and there are no social sharing features included. If you decide to use this app, you do so absolutely anonymous.

Breath Ball is a philanthropic project and you are more than welcome to use it. In case of questions or suggestions feel free to drop as an email at michael@breathball.com

Thanks for reading. Feel free to download Breath Ball now.

comments: It's a great app even before going pro (which in my case is not needed. I try to use it once a day just to help me control my breath while meditating. Strongly recommended.

I like this app a lot but it's not fully developed. I would not invest in the premium version yet as the free version has plenty of glitches. I find it helpful and I think it has a great Foundation to be a frontrunner. I specifically like the breathing bar although only comes with premium. I like being able to change the colors making it easier on my eyes and less stressful to use. I also like the defined breathing exercises for Sleep stress COPD excetera. But the app needs work.

Awesome customisable app,only thing missing is dark mode and import own background sounds in case one doesn't like the ones there/for variety.Maybe the white screen should have some pastel colours with shades changing as the ball moves? Upon completion of a longer time maybe an encouraging message like "well done or you've improved " to encourage people to return to the app? So good I recommended it to a friend who enjoys it :D thank you so much makers of this app !!😊 No account needed,yay !

This app has potential, but presently has annoying glitches: 1) has several audible glitches in the audio (inhale and exhale cues), 2) no delayed start is available, 3) always asks confirmation before exiting (it should not do this unkess you are in the middle of a session. It should also provide the option to turn this confirmation off.)

Visual of ball and adjustment of timing is great. But the audio glitches that make a crackling sound every time the audio cue happens makes this app unusable with the sound on. Yes, you can just turn the audio guide off, but the audio guide, without the glitches, would really add to the meditative experience and would allow you to not have to be looking at the ball 100% of the time.

title: Breathe Better: Beat Asthma!
description:
Breathe Better: Beat Asthma is a patient engagement game, administered by members of the health care team, where players interact with and guide various characters who experience asthma symptoms. The game focuses on reinforcement of critical self-maintenance skills necessary for asthma patients to stay out of the hospital.  Players help the various characters take their control and rescue medications at the appropriate times. Players need to watch out for triggers like animal dander, cold weather, physical exertion, strong chemical odors, and so on because they could negatively affect the character’s progress and might cause them to be admitted to the hospital. At the end of the game, patients are given feedback on their guidance of each character - whether they helped them take their medication at the appropriate times and whether or not they were admitted to the hospital.

Breathe Better: Beat Asthma was developed by UPMC Children’s Hospital of Pittsburgh and Simcoach Games as part of a clinical study to evaluate the effectiveness of video-game-based interventions in patient education. The study is currently ongoing. The behavior demonstrated in this app is for narrative
purposes and features fictional characters. The care and treatment of pulmonary health issues is different for each patient. The user should derive proper treatment of pulmonary issues from their medical care providers, not this application. This app does not replace professional medical consultation and care.

Privacy Policy: http://www.simcoachgames.com/privacy

title: Asthma Medications, Asthma Causes
description:
Asthma is generally managed through a combination of controller medication and reliever medication. Here you'll find information about the types of treatments available to get your asthma under control

Never before have we had so many good, safe oral and inhaled drugs for the treatment of asthma as we do today. It is important that the drug regimen be carefully tailored to the needs of the individual. This can be achieved by working with your physician to determine the optimum medical regimen designed to achieve control over your athma.

There are many different types of asthma medicines and sometimes you will have to take more than one. 

- preventers – inhalers or tablets taken every day to prevent asthma symptoms from developing

- relievers – inhalers taken when needed to ease asthma symptoms

- steroid tablets – used for a short time when symptoms are severe.

Asthma medicines are generally available in two main types of inhaler devices – metered dose inhalers (MDI) or puffers and dry powder inhalers such as Turbuhalers, Accuhalers and Handihalers.

Download this Asthma Medications app now for get more info.

You may search : What is asthma , Seasonal asthma, Natural cure for asthma, Breathing exercises for asthma, Natural asthma treatment, Exercise asthma

This application features are :-

You can bookmark Favorite articles(post)

This application helps you to read the article(post) - Once click 'Read Article' button, automatically read the page content(Text to Speech).

You can share the article(post) to your friends, family and social networks.

You can copy the text from any post.

You can enable notification

You can adjust font size(small, medium, big) of articles

title: Breathcount | asthma app
description:
Breathcount is an application for people with asthma or COPD who are using peak flow meter. To help them keep a record of their condition and manage it.

- Never lose your data. 
You data will be synced to any device you use.

- Get better.
Breathcount will show your condition after you enter your peak flow value as well as display your progress over time. 

- Prevent wheezing and coughing.
It will warn of your condition decrease in familiar stop light system. Use the daily asthma forecast to avoid provoking symptoms.

- Parent warnings.
Your child can use it on its own but you can set up warnings to be sent to your email if peak flow indicates a decrease in your condition.

- Doctor friendly.
We have a PDF data export of any period in a familiar peak flow chart format.

- Reminders for PEFM
Don't miss a breath into your peak flow meter by setting up custom reminders. 

Check out our Asthma Test app to be even better master of your condition.

Up next: Asthma diary for medication.



Breathcount is still in beta. Please let us know if you have any problems with it. In addition to this, let us know what you think and help us make this app better by giving feedback: feedback@breathcount.com

title: myPeakFlow
description:
myPeakFlow is an app use to monitor your asthma, by logging your peak flow (device used to measure the amount of air exhaled out in L/min) readings, age, height, gender, on your phone or tablet, the program calculates what the predicted peak flow measurement would be. You can look a history graph, and manage multiple users.
You can export or import your history data to a file, and a Windows app is also available.

title: TOTAAL - Asthma and Allergies
description:
Tropical Outdoor Triggers of Asthma and Allergies (TOTAAL ) application is a free app that provides de levels of pollen and fungal spores for the benefit of allergy sufferers. TOTAAL app is for individual with allergies specifically fungal spores that triggers allergies of the eyes (allergic conjunctivitis), the nose (allergic rhinitis), the skin (atopic dermatitis/eczema and or hives) and those with asthma. This app will help you correlate your allergies and asthma with the local fungal counts.
 
TOTAAL app allows you to see real pollen and fungal spore counts in San Juan, PR. TOTAAL app has been developed by Dr. Benjamin Bolaños, Director an d founder of the San Juan, PR AAAAI Station of the Medical Sciences Campus, of the University of Puerto Rico. . Dr. Bolaños is an Associate Professor of the Department of Microbiology of the Medical Sciences Campus, University of Puerto Rico. He has been involved in clinical studies on the role of fungal spores as allergens and purification of tropical fungal allergens. 

Any use of this information provided by the app is for personal use only.
 
The TOTAAL app are the property of the San Juan Station of the Medical Sciences Campus. Any use, copying, reproducing or re-publishing of these these materials is prohibited without the prior written approval of Benjamin Bolaños and the Medical Sciences Campus, University of Puerto Rico.

title: MySpira
description:
Only compatible with ARCore enabled devices.

Play the world’s first augmented reality asthma inhaler training game, developed in collaboration with healthcare professionals.

Meet Spira! An asthmatic alien from the planet Bronchia who needs your help!

With the assistance of Dr Woozo and some proven behavioural learning techniques, within a truly immersive setting, your child will better understand Asthma and improved inhaler technique.

Download for FREE, meet Spira, and try out the Letter Jumble & Super Inhaler levels. One in-app purchase allows for premium access and a further 6 levels of fun learning, a Personalised Action Plan and our bonus AR Dust Buster game.

Free content
◆ Play Letter Jumble and Super Inhaler
◆ Learn why the preventer and reliever inhalers are so important
◆ Interact with objects in augmented reality
◆ Earn badges for completing challenges

Premium content (one purchase)
◆ Assemble a standard metered dose inhaler (MDI) with a spacer
◆ Collect cards to remind you of the important facts
◆ Learn and practice correct inhaler usage
◆ Create a personalised Asthma Action Plan
◆ BONUS AR GAME - Dust Buster

Whether you have asthma or want to know more about it, this multi award winning AR experience will educate your child about the condition whilst also having fun!

title: Hailie - Asthma & COPD Companion
description:
Hailie™ is your asthma and COPD sidekick. The Hailie™ solution is always by your side to help you manage your chronic respiratory condition.

Our smart, personal medication monitoring system helps you manage your asthma and COPD by providing the tools necessary to help track your medication usage. This helps promote medication adherence, increasing the effectiveness of your medication, so you can enjoy life with fewer symptoms.

The Hailie™ app can be used as a standalone application or in conjunction with a Hailie™ sensor.

Benefits of the Hailie™ solution:

Real-time reporting, monitoring, storing and analysis of your inhaler use
Insight into medication usage patterns
Audiovisual reminders on your phone or tablet

How do I purchase a Hailie™ sensor?
=============================
You can purchase the Hailie™ sensors via our online store. Go to hailie.com. Please note the store is currently only available for US and New Zealand customers.

What is the Hailie™ solution?
================
The Hailie™ solution is an ecosystem of sensors and apps that help patients and healthcare professionals manage breathing conditions and medications.
The Bluetooth enabled Hailie™ sensors, which are FDA-cleared and CE-marked, wrap around an existing inhaler and automatically track medication usage, which is then displayed on a phone or tablet. Using the Hailie™ app allows you to track your medication adherence, set daily reminders, and discover insights into how you use your medication.
Clinical evidence shows that using the Hailie™ solution for asthma management increases adherence to preventative and maintenance medications and reduces attacks in adults and children. 

More information is available at www.hailie.com.

title: CHANGE Asthma
description: CHANGE Asthma is an educational resource for asthmatics describing inhaler proper use. The app links to videos describing the proper use and administration of an inhaler, as well as three educational games. The games include a medicine identifier game and the Green-Yellow-Red game. These games are meant to support the in-clinic explanation how to use an inhaler, identify the severity and need of a rescue inhaler, and when to use a controller vs. rescue inhaler. This app is not a substitute for talking to your doctor.

title: BWH Asthma
description:
The Brigham and Women’s Hospital Asthma Application (BWH Asthma App) enables individuals to keep track of their asthma symptoms between regular clinic visits via short weekly multiple choice questionnaires. Answers are available to the patient’s care team. This app is part of a research study and is not meant to replace professional medical/clinical care. All participants must receive continuing care from a physician at BWH to be a part of this research study. Registration to the platform requires a verified email address and agreement to the BWH Asthma App Terms of Services. 

Physicians are not required to use any information from this study in evaluating and managing Asthma. If participants want to speak to their physicians, they should call them directly and/or set up a clinic visit. Subjects with emergencies should call 911.  


This app was developed as part of a partnership between the RAND Corporation and Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

title: Asthma Health Storylines
description:
Asthma Storylines from the Allergy & Asthma Network, and powered by Health Storylines™, is a self-care tool for managing asthma for yourself or your loved one. 

Asthma Storylines allows you to track and gain insights about daily asthma control for yourself or your child, keep track of questions you have for your healthcare provider, and more. It gives you an accurate, shareable record of the asthma experience between physician visits, and helps you and your care-team collaborate on treatment strategies. 

Take control of asthma with these powerful Health Tools:

• Track and gain insights about daily asthma control 
• Take notes on questions you have for your healthcare provider before visits and during visits
• Track medication and set reminders so you don’t forget a dose (Disclaimer: App only contains medication database for US and Canada at this time. Other countries medication databases coming soon.) 
• Track symptoms to monitor how you or your loved one is doing over time
• Document moods to see the impact of emotional health on overall wellbeing
• Remember important dates and events with an in-app calendar 
• Record weight and other vitals to have handy whenever you need them
• Document your health and daily living with a journal
• Invite the people who care for you to connect as part of your Circle of Support. Share progress with them in real time. Let them empower you with their support and encouragement, give you a boost when you need it, and celebrate your milestones. 

The Asthma Storylines mobile app is free for all users. There is also a Web version available, accessible through the browser of any desktop computer or mobile device.

title: NHS Wales: Asthmahub
description:
This NHS Wales management app is the place to go to manage your asthma. View your personalised asthma action plan, watch instructional and educational videos delivered by the asthma experts in Wales, monitor and record your asthma symptoms and tests, and get helpful advice for when your asthma symptoms get worse.

- A summary of important information about your asthma in one place
- Designed and supported by NHS experts
- A decision support tool to help manage your symptoms 
- General education about staying well 
- Videos from the experts providing general strategies for managing any triggers and symptoms
- A log of important asthma information to discuss with your healthcare professional
- Information about the medications and spacers prescribed to you
- Download your asthma action plan
- Diary and appointments
- Asthma contacts list
- Monitoring symptoms and peak flow
- Undertake a peak flow diary 
- Weather updates and pollen information
- Choose either English or Welsh language

The information and advice on this app are put together by specialists within the NHS, so it is as accurate as possible. However, the app is to promote self-management of asthma, and not to act specifically as a medical tool. The content in the App is provided for general information only. It is not intended to amount to advice on which you should solely rely. Always seek advice from your healthcare practitioner.

title: Prana Breath: Calm & Meditate
description:
Dive into breathing techniques that are approved by ancient traditions, by modern science and by million+ of our users! Use the power of breathing and meditation to increase your mindfulness and live a better life. It doesn't matter whether you do Yoga, dieting, diving, or not, - you will see the positive impact anyway, for only 7-15 minutes a day!

What does it do?
* Improves brain activity: memory, attention, concentration
* Relieves anxiety
* Develops resistance to stress, develops physical endurance
* Eliminates evening appetite attacks, thus helps to have a healthy weight
* Decreases the frequency of cold, migraine and asthma attacks
* Boosts immunity of respiratory system
* Promotes healthy sleep
* Improves vocal and breath hold time, thus is good for singer and diver
* Trains the diaphragm thus fights acid reflux (GERD) symptoms

Why Prana Breath?
* Absolutely no advertisement
* Fast, optimized, battery saving
* Easy - just tap on "play", close your eyes and let the sound guide you
* Option to turn the screen off during the training
* 8 breathing patterns for different purposes
* Possibility to create your own patterns
* Rich statistics
* Reminders for creating a convenient training schedule
* Most patterns are derived from Pranayama, Sufi and Tibetan breathing practices
* Unique to Google Play "Anti-Appetite" training, for fighting emotional over-eating
* Exclusive "Cigarette replace", designed by Simone Righini, to help you quit smoking

Additionally for Guru version:
* Dynamic trainings for smooth improvement & for sophisticated patterns
* Diverse breath methods and chants
* Detailed progress chart and training log
* Health tests
* Enriched settings and more sounds
* Regularly updated database of more than 50 training patterns, such as: 4-7-8 breathing, Kapalbhati, Anulom Vilom, Nadi Shodhana, Tummo / Inner fire, Udgeeth, etc.

Scientific proofs: https://pranabreath.info/wiki/Research_articles
Facebook: https://facebook.com/OlekdiaPranaBreath

comments: I love the app, but I can't figure out how to sustain for more than 99 seconds. Maybe someone could take a breather and tell me. I'm sorry for not being more clear in my review. I'm trying to edit "Tummo" to do the "Wim Hoff" method. When I go to "ratio of breath cycle", it only goes up to 99 seconds. How do I make it go longer? I think it has something to do with "seconds per ratio unit" but I'm sort of confused. I was good at math in college, but that was over 50 years ago. Things are getting more discombobulated with age.

All i needed to commit to a regular breathing practice is right here within this app. The wiki has been a very valuable resource to learn about breath work, how to practice, as well as the form and function of the app. I literally love this app and use it every day. It has certainly been one of the keys to help me create personal transform.

I love this app and the paid version is so worth having. Breathwork is increasingly important in my self-care routine and I've just reincorporated this app into it, and I'm so glad I did. A little bit tricky to twiddle with if you're setting up custom breathing patterns but that's because you need to think about them mathematically, so not an issue with the app at all!

Dear Oleksandr, there should be a way to hear the phase transition only once, instead of twice when it alternates between exhale and inhale. ie. I am inhaling for 5 seconds and 5 seconds exhale. I only want to hear phase transition once, after every 10 seconds, instead of every 5 seconds. there is no way to do this currently since exhale or inhale cannot be set to 0, but retain and sustain can be set to 0. When I am listening to this for hours in the background, less noise helps. Thanks.

It is the best app out there. I have never written a recommendation before, but this app deserves it. I have trouble counting the seconds of my breathing while doing it and this app has sound effects so even with closed eyes you know when to inhale, hold, exhale. It has different techniques and I also customised to my way in the free version. It is really the best. Can't recommend it enough. Just download it!

title: Asthma
description: "Most children and adults with asthma find they have times when their breathing becomes more difficult. Some people with more severe asthma may have breathing problems most of the time. The exact cause of asthma is unknown. People with asthma have inflamed (swollen) and sensitive airways that become narrow and clogged with sticky mucus in response to certain triggers. Factors such as a genes, air pollution, chlorine in swimming pools and modern hygiene standards have been suggested as possible causes, but there's not currently enough evidence to be certain whether any of these do cause asthma. The main treatments are: •	avoiding asthma triggers whenever possible  •	short-acting reliever inhalers – inhalers used when needed to quickly relieve asthma symptoms for a short time, by relaxing the breathing tubes  •	preventer inhalers – inhalers used regularly every day to reduce inflammation in the breathing tubes and stop asthma symptoms occurring  •	combined preventer and long-acting reliever inhalers – inhalers used regularly every day which help stop asthma symptoms occurring and relax the breathing tubes for a longer period  Download this free Asthma application to learn more about asthma copd"
